title: ollama/ollama
summary: Official Ollama repo: self-hosted LLM runner with a built-in model library and simple CLI/API.
highlights: pull & run Llama 3, Mistral, Gemma locally

title: ollama-js
summary: Official JavaScript/TypeScript client for the Ollama API (npm: ollama).

title: ollama-python
summary: Official Python client for Ollama (PyPI: ollama).

title: langchain-ollama
summary: LangChain integration package to use Ollama models as LLMs or embedders.

title: ollama-webui
summary: Feature-rich web UI for Ollama (chat, models, admin) installable via Docker.

title: ollama4j
summary: Java/Kotlin client library for Ollama with POJO model mappings.

title: ollama-cli
summary: Community-enhanced CLI wrapper with interactive prompts and config profiles.

title: ollama-copilot
summary: VS Code extension bringing local Ollama models as inline Copilot suggestions.

title: ollama-helm
summary: Helm chart for deploying Ollama on Kubernetes with GPU node selection.

title: ollama-rb
summary: Ruby gem providing an idiomatic client for Ollama’s REST API.

title: ollama-dotnet
summary: .NET SDK for Ollama with strongly-typed request/response models.

title: ollama-csharp
summary: Lightweight C# client targeting .NET 6+ with minimal dependencies.

title: ollama-dagger
summary: Dagger module that spins up Ollama as a CI service for testing LLM features.

title: ollama-haystack
summary: Haystack integration to use Ollama models for generative QA & summarization.

title: ollama-rust
summary: Rust crate providing async bindings to the Ollama REST API.

title: ollama-cogs
summary: Discord.py cogs to chat with Ollama models right inside Discord servers.

title: ollama-streamlit
summary: Streamlit chat component template that connects to a local Ollama instance.

title: ollama-n8n-node
summary: Official n8n node to invoke Ollama models inside automation workflows.

title: ollama-elixir
summary: Elixir library wrapping Ollama with GenServer-based process management.

title: ollama-zig
summary: Zig client for Ollama demonstrating HTTP requests with std.http.
